title: Sri Lankan Couple Trying To Smuggle Gold Worth Rs 37 Lakh In Rectums Caught At Chennai Airport

Sri Lankan Couple Trying To Smuggle Gold Worth Rs 37 Lakh In Rectums Caught At Chennai Airport

Sri Lankan Couple Trying To Smuggle Gold Worth Rs 37 Lakh In Rectums Caught At Chennai Airport

Shoving valuables up butts is the hottest new trend in the smuggling world and these daring people carry some serious stuff in their rectums, gold being the most popular of the lot.

More recently, a couple from Sri Lanka thought they could pull wool over the eyes of customs officials at Chennai Airport. But things didn't go as they'd planned.

Reuters

The two got royally busted during a screening and officials retrieved gold worth a mind boggling Rs 37 lakh from them.

According to ANI, the accused were identified as Sivakumar Palaniyandi, 42, and Sagay Mary, 35.

"The personal search of Sivakumar resulted in the recovery of assorted gold jewellery of 94 per cent purity, weighing 525 grams and valued at Rs 19.5 lakh," a press release said.

"That of Sagay Mary resulted in the recovery of assorted gold jewellery of 22 K purity weighing 128 gms which is valued at Rs 4.7 lakh and 320 grams of gold valued at Rs 12.6 lakhs was recovered from the gold paste which was concealed in the rectum," it added.

In total, gold weighing 973gm valued at Rs 37 lakh was recovered.

In a similar incident, that took place in September this year, a man was arrested at the Delhi airport upon his arrival from the UAE for allegedly smuggling gold bars worth over Rs 31 lakh in his rectum.

Ahmed Washir, who arrived at Terminal-3 of the Indira Gandhi International Airport from Dubai by an Air India flight, was intercepted after he had crossed the green channel.

The recovered gold, worth Rs 31,86,533, was seized and the person arrested under relevant provisions of the Customs Act, reports PTI.
